# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    for i in 1:length(text)
        if (i - 1) % text_width == 0 && i > 1 || i == length(text) + 1
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        if text[i] == ' ' || text[i] == '\n'
            push!(lines, text[i])
        else
            push!(lines, String([text[j] for j in (i - 1):(i + text_width) if j <= length(text)]))
            break
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

# Example

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello World! This is a very long sentence that will require wrapping.")
"Hello World! This is a very long\nsentence that will require wrapping."
```
